019
020package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.indentation;
021
022import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.DetailAST;
023import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.TokenTypes;
024import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.TokenUtil;
025
026/**
027 * Handler for lambda expressions.
028 *
029 */
030public class LambdaHandler extends AbstractExpressionHandler {
031    /**
032     * Checks whether the lambda is correctly indented, this variable get its value from checking
033     * the lambda handler's indentation, and it is being used in aligning the lambda's children.
034     * A true value depicts lambda is correctly aligned without giving any errors.
035     * This is updated to false where there is any Indentation error log.
036     */
037    private boolean isLambdaCorrectlyIndented = true;
038
039    /**
040     * Construct an instance of this handler with the given indentation check,
041     * abstract syntax tree, and parent handler.
042     *
043     * @param indentCheck the indentation check
044     * @param ast the abstract syntax tree
045     * @param parent the parent handler
046     */
047    public LambdaHandler(IndentationCheck indentCheck,
048                         DetailAST ast, AbstractExpressionHandler parent) {
049        super(indentCheck, "lambda", ast, parent);
050    }
051
052    @Override
053    public IndentLevel getSuggestedChildIndent(AbstractExpressionHandler child) {
054        IndentLevel childIndent = getIndent();
055        if (isLambdaCorrectlyIndented) {
056            if (child instanceof SlistHandler) {
057                // // Lambda with block body (enclosed in {})
058                childIndent = IndentLevel.addAcceptable(childIndent, getLineStart(getMainAst()),
059                    getLineStart(getMainAst().getFirstChild()));
060            }
061            else {
062                // Single-expression lambda (no {} block):
063                // assume line wrapping and add additional indentation
064                // for the statement in the next line.
065                childIndent = new IndentLevel(childIndent,
066                        getIndentCheck().getLineWrappingIndentation());
067            }
068        }
069
070        return childIndent;
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * {@inheritDoc}.
075     *
076     * @noinspection MethodWithMultipleReturnPoints
077     * @noinspectionreason MethodWithMultipleReturnPoints - indentation is complex and
078     *      tightly coupled, thus making this method difficult to refactor
079     */
080    @Override
081    protected IndentLevel getIndentImpl() {
082        if (getParent() instanceof MethodCallHandler) {
083            return getParent().getSuggestedChildIndent(this);
084        }
085
086        DetailAST parent = getMainAst().getParent();
087        if (getParent() instanceof NewHandler) {
088            parent = parent.getParent();
089        }
090
091        // Use the start of the parent's line as the reference indentation level.
092        IndentLevel level = new IndentLevel(getLineStart(parent));
093
094        // If the start of the lambda is the first element on the line;
095        // assume line wrapping with respect to its parent.
096        final DetailAST firstChild = getMainAst().getFirstChild();
097        if (getLineStart(firstChild) == expandedTabsColumnNo(firstChild)) {
098            level = new IndentLevel(level, getIndentCheck().getLineWrappingIndentation());
099        }
100
101        return level;
102    }
103
104    @Override
105    public void checkIndentation() {
106        final DetailAST mainAst = getMainAst();
107        final DetailAST firstChild = mainAst.getFirstChild();
108
109        // If the "->" has no children, it is a switch
110        // rule lambda (i.e. 'case ONE -> 1;')
111        final boolean isSwitchRuleLambda = firstChild == null;
112
113        if (!isSwitchRuleLambda
114            && getLineStart(firstChild) == expandedTabsColumnNo(firstChild)) {
115            final int firstChildColumnNo = expandedTabsColumnNo(firstChild);
116            final IndentLevel level = getIndent();
117
118            if (isNonAcceptableIndent(firstChildColumnNo, level)) {
119                isLambdaCorrectlyIndented = false;
120                logError(firstChild, "arguments", firstChildColumnNo, level);
121            }
122        }
123
124        // If the "->" is the first element on the line, assume line wrapping.
125        final int mainAstColumnNo = expandedTabsColumnNo(mainAst);
126        final boolean isLineWrappedLambda = mainAstColumnNo == getLineStart(mainAst);
127        if (isLineWrappedLambda) {
128            checkLineWrappedLambda(isSwitchRuleLambda, mainAstColumnNo);
129        }
130
131        final DetailAST nextSibling = mainAst.getNextSibling();
132
133        if (isSwitchRuleLambda
134                && nextSibling.getType() == TokenTypes.EXPR
135                && !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(mainAst, nextSibling)) {
136            // Likely a single-statement switch rule lambda without curly braces, e.g.:
137            // case ONE ->
138            //      1;
139            checkSingleStatementSwitchRuleIndentation(isLineWrappedLambda);
140        }
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Checks that given indent is acceptable or not.
145     *
146     * @param astColumnNo indent value to check
147     * @param level indent level
148     * @return true if indent is not acceptable
149     */
150    private boolean isNonAcceptableIndent(int astColumnNo, IndentLevel level) {
151        return astColumnNo < level.getFirstIndentLevel()
152            || getIndentCheck().isForceStrictCondition()
153               && !level.isAcceptable(astColumnNo);
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * This method checks a line wrapped lambda, whether it is a lambda
158     * expression or switch rule lambda.
159     *
160     * @param isSwitchRuleLambda if mainAst is a switch rule lambda
161     * @param mainAstColumnNo the column number of the lambda we are checking
162     */
163    private void checkLineWrappedLambda(final boolean isSwitchRuleLambda,
164                                        final int mainAstColumnNo) {
165        final IndentLevel level;
166        final DetailAST mainAst = getMainAst();
167
168        if (isSwitchRuleLambda) {
169            // We check the indentation of the case literal or default literal
170            // on the previous line and use that to determine the correct
171            // indentation for the line wrapped "->"
172            final DetailAST previousSibling = mainAst.getPreviousSibling();
173            final int previousLineStart = getLineStart(previousSibling);
174
175            level = new IndentLevel(new IndentLevel(previousLineStart),
176                    getIndentCheck().getLineWrappingIndentation());
177        }
178        else {
179            level = new IndentLevel(getIndent(),
180                getIndentCheck().getLineWrappingIndentation());
181        }
182
183        if (isNonAcceptableIndent(mainAstColumnNo, level)) {
184            isLambdaCorrectlyIndented = false;
185            logError(mainAst, "", mainAstColumnNo, level);
186        }
187    }
188
189    /**
190     * Checks the indentation of statements inside a single-statement switch rule
191     * when the statement is not on the same line as the lambda operator ({@code ->}).
192     * This applies to single-statement switch rules without curly braces {@code {}}.
193     * Example:
194     * <pre>
195     * case ONE {@code ->}
196     *     1;
197     * </pre>
198     *
199     * @param isLambdaFirstInLine if {@code ->} is the first element on the line
200     */
201    private void checkSingleStatementSwitchRuleIndentation(boolean isLambdaFirstInLine) {
202        final DetailAST mainAst = getMainAst();
203        IndentLevel level = getParent().getSuggestedChildIndent(this);
204
205        if (isLambdaFirstInLine) {
206            // If the lambda operator (`->`) is at the start of the line, assume line wrapping
207            // and add additional indentation for the statement in the next line.
208            level = new IndentLevel(level, getIndentCheck().getLineWrappingIndentation());
209        }
210
211        // The first line should not match if the switch rule statement starts on the same line
212        // as "->" but continues onto the next lines as part of a single logical expression.
213        final DetailAST nextSibling = mainAst.getNextSibling();
214        final boolean firstLineMatches = getFirstLine(nextSibling) != mainAst.getLineNo();
215        checkExpressionSubtree(nextSibling, level, firstLineMatches, false);
216    }
217}
